sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Alan of Tewkesbury OSB, Epistolae. Apocryphal Gospels. Prophecies
Alani Cantuar. Epistolae. Gesta Salvatoris. Infantia Salvatoris, etc.
msDesc.p: Vellum, 250 185 , 9.9 x 7.3, ff. 1 + 124 + 1, several volumes of cent. xii-xiii .

Volume I: 30 lines to a page. Cent. xiii (?) early, in a fine hand.
Volume II: Double columns of 45 lines in a fine small hand of cent. xiii.
Volume III: Double columns of 47 lines. Cent. xiii.
Volume IV: 26 lines to a page: a large black hand of cent xiii.
Volume V: Double columns of 32 lines. Cent. xii, in a very pretty hand.

From Christ Church, Canterbury, Ancient Libraries, p. 118.
On the flyleaf (xiv):
Liber N. de Sandwyco. In quo scilicet(?) hec uolumina continentur.
(1) [Epistole Alani Prioris, etc.: added xvi.]
(2) Liber de officiis ecclesiasticis.
(3) Euangelium Nazareorum.
(4) Inffancia Saluatoris.
(5) Liber Asenech.
(6) Item liber Methodii (over erasure).
Other articles added xvi. f. iv blank. N. de Sandwich was Prior 1255-1280.

In the old catalogue the contents are thus given:
Liber officiis ecclesiasticis
Glose super Osee.
Infancia Saluatoris.
Euangelium Nazareorum.
Asseneth.
Methodius.
Prophetia Hildegardi(s).
Epistole Frederici Imperatoris
Libellus qualiter Tartari inuaserunt regna Christianorum.

msItem.head: Alan of Tewkesbury OSB, Epistolae

head.title: Alani prioris ecclesiae Christi Cantuariae epistolae ad Henricum III. ad regem Franciae et alios ; praesertim de translatione corporis Thomae Becket; -et ad Baldwinum archiepiscopum de jure et potestate sedis metropolitanae in episcopum et sedem Roffensem, nempe quod episcopus Rossensis in capitulo ecclesiae Cantuariae eligi debet, ibique spiritualia et temporalia a manu archiepiscopi accipere; et quod monachi Roffenses mortuo episcopo suo baculum ejus pastoralem apud Cantuariam portare tenentur, -item una vel altera epistola ad Alanum

msItem.ab: 10. Asino illi Sancti Petri de Burgo
Edited in 1846 by J. A. Giles, from this, the only MS.: reprinted in P. L. CXC 1475

msItem.incipit: Est tempus luctus et pene. Item hec tempora considerantur secundum iiiior principales diei partes
Hec autem officia ordinauit beatus Jeronimus ad petitionem damasi pape
Incipientes ab aduentu de ecclesiasticis officiis per anni circulum in duobus canendum esse dicimus circa illa ne coacte fiant et indiscrete
De officio ecclesiastico distincte egimus per totum anni circulum
msItem.explicit: Domine ne in furore cantatur quia quod dauid prophetauit apostolus predicauit

msItem.head: Richard the Premonstratensian, De canone missae

head.title: Alius tractatus ejusdem, ut videtur, argumenti

msItem.ab: Expositio missae (Remigius of Auxerre) cf. CLXXVII 455
msItem.incipit: In uirtute sancte crucis
msItem.explicit: ex inde uita eterna
msItem.incipit: Hec sententia de vii ordinibus clericorum
Postquam duo discipuli uenerunt de (e)maus
Simile est regnum celorum homini negotiatori
Quandoque boni sicius moriuntur

head.title: Gesta salvatoris Domini nostri Iesu Christi, quae invenit Theodosius magnus imperator in Ierusalem in pretorio Pontii Pilati in codicibus publicis

msItem.rubric: Gregorius turonensis in gestis francorum de passione et resurrectione domini Ihesu refert hec
msItem.incipit: Apprehensus autem ioseph cum aromatibus
msItem.explicit: quod non ad eum primitus aduenisset
msItem.rubric: Sanctus Augustinus in sermone de sancto sabbato pasche dicit
msItem.incipit: Attonite mentes obstupuere tortorum
msItem.explicit: per lignum ditati sumus per lignum euertimur
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt gesta saluatoris domini nostri Ihesu Christi que inuenit Theodosius magnus imperator in Ierusalem in pretorio poncii pilati in codicibus publicis
msItem.incipit: Factum est in anno uicesimo tercio imperii tyberii
msItem.explicit: Istum nouiinus ihesum fabri filium de uirgine
msItem.incipit: Audistis fratres karissimi que acta sunt sub pontio pilato presidi temporibus tiberii cesaris. Ego eneas hebreus primus legis doctor perscrutans diuinitatem legis scripturarum domini nostri Ihesu Christi
msItem.ab: With Tischendorf's second text of the Descensus, Evv. Apocr. p. 417, ending
msItem.explicit: Hec sunt testimonia carini et leutii fratres karissimi de christo dei filio que sanctis suis gessit apud inferos cui omnes agamus laudes cui honor et gloria per immensa seculorum secula. Amen

msItem.incipit: In diebus tiberii cesaris tetraharcha sub poncio pilato traditus fuit Ihesus a iudeis
msItem.explicit: baptizatus est et domus eius tota. In nomine domini nostri Ihesu Christi cui honor et gloria et imperium in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.incipit: Apostolus dicit. Nolite inebriari uino in quo luxuria
msItem.explicit: sicut equs et mulus quibus non est intellectus
msItem.incipit: Nos (Uos) inquam conuenio o iudei qui usque in hodiernum diem negastis filium dei
msItem.ab: This disputation against the Jews is frequently found as an appendix to the Gesta Salvatoris in a certain family of MSS.
msItem.explicit: lnundi huius principe. Nostri hodie ac semper hic et ubique dignatus miserere
msItem.ab: This copy has been examined by Dr E. v. Dobsch¸tz for his forthcoming edition of the Acta Pilati

msItem.head: pseudo-Jerome, De ortu beatae Mariae et infantia saluatoris

head.title: Libellus de infantia salvatoris nostri et de ejus cognatis Ioachimo Anna, et de miraculis virginis Mariae, etc.

ab.quote: Ad finem, Haec omnia Thomas Ismaelita ego scripsi.

ab.handNote: The first page in the hand of f. 38

msItem.rubric: Libellus de infantia Saluatoris domini nostri Ihesu Christi
msItem.incipit: Ex ioachim cleopha saloma iii anna marias
Anna et emeria sorores fuerunt. De emeria nata est elizabeth
msItem.explicit: Ex hac nati sunt Iacobus maior et Iohannis euuangelista
msItem.ab: another hand (perhaps that of ff. 39r-65v) begins in columns of 35 lines
msItem.rubric: Incipit capitulum cromatii elodori episcoporum Joronimo presbitero
msItem.incipit: Hortum marie uirginis et natiuitatem, etc.
msItem.explicit: credideris recipere facias
msItem.incipit: Dominis sanctis
msItem.explicit: Obedientiam peruenire
msItem.incipit: In diebus illis. Erat uir in israel nomine ioachim
msItem.explicit: claritas dei resplendebat super eum. cui sit omnis laus et gloria in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: So far the Liber de infantia (Ps. Matthew of Tischendorf) proper
Here follow three chapters which in Tischendorf (p. 164) precede the gospel of Thomas as here
msItem.incipit: Cum iacta fuisset conturbatio quando requisitio facta fuit ab herode de domino nostro Ihesu Christo
msItem.ab: (Flight into Egypt. Jesus eats ears of corn, makes a salt fish swim)
msItem.incipit: Et deambulante Ihesus cum maria
msItem.ab: (22 sparrows fall into a schoolmaster's lap)
msItem.incipit: Et hoc facto magister cepit eum proicere de ciuitate
msItem.explicit: et dedit gratias deo qui dedit ei talem intelligentiam et quia inuenit gratiam coram domino deo Amen
msItem.ab: A text of the Gospel of Thomas follows (Tischendorf, p. 167)
msItem.incipit: Gloriosum est enarrare thomam ismaelitam traplos domini. Intelligite ergo omnes fratres carissimi sig(na) que fecit Ihesus quando fuit in ciuitate nazareth quod est primo capitulo. cum autem esset Ihesus v. annorum facta est pluuia etc.
msItem.explicit: omnes qui uidebant eum glorificabant deum patrem omnipotentem qui est benedictus in secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.incipit: Hec omnia thomas ismaelita ego scripsi
msItem.explicit: filius dei in uniuerso orbe terre. Ipsum decet omnis gloria et honor in sempiternum. qui uiuis et regnas deus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.incipit: Post peccatum ade
msItem.explicit: usque ad mortem. Cui est laus et honor et imperium per omnia secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: Cf. MS 66, MS 275, etc. Ed. W. Meyer, Abh. bayer. Akad. XVI, iii, 131

head.title: Historia quaedam fabulosa, quarum titulos recensere haud operae pretium

msItem.ab: De S. Bernardo. de caseo. de simia ... de baldewino archiepiscopo ... de Magistro Roberto (de Chartres) ... de quodam Robineto (a goblin) ... De Gillebochat (quidam priuatus demon Gillebochat dictus) ... The last De Thaide

ab.supplied: This collection of stories occurs again in MS 441 (Art. 31), which is also a Christ Church book

head.title: Liber de Asenech et quomodo Joseph duxit eam in uxorem

msItem.rubric: Liber de asenech et quomodo ioseph duxit eam in uxorem
msItem.incipit: Et factum est in primo anno
msItem.ab: This is the complete Latin text: published by Batiffol, Studia Patristica, in a text furnished by me from this MS. and MS 424
msItem.explicit: nuncupatus est pater eius in terra egypti
msItem.ab: Poem to the Virgin. The first lines spaced for music, which is not filled in

lg.l: Hominum salue saluatrix uirgo mater filia
... fac nos tecum liberos et prosperos

msItem.ab: Poem on the corruption of the Church. Space left for music as before

lg.l: O O cui cuncta seruiunt uide culia (?ciuilia)
tua scit clemencia scit et anglia quod ita despiciunt.

msItem.head: pseudo-Methodius, De initio et fine saeculi

head.title: Liber Methodii martyris de initio seculi et fine, etc.

msItem.incipit: In nomine Christi incipit liber methodii episcopi ecclesie paterensis etc.
msItem.explicit: in opusculis suis collaudauit
msItem.incipit: Sciendum namque est nobis
msItem.explicit: eripere dignetur qui etc.
msItem.ab: Also in MS 59. 12; MS 66. 26; MS 275. 6; MS 404. 2, etc.

msItem.head: Hildegard of Bingen OSB, Letter to the clergy of Cologne
msItem.incipit: Incipit epistola beate hildegardis de re operto iuxta pinguiam de futura tribulatione clericorum et de uero tempore. De uiuente luce audiui uocem
msItem.explicit: in confortissima vi rectitudinis persistent
msItem.incipit: Cum inter reges orbis et principes affinitas
msItem.explicit: a quibus expectare debeamus consilium et a quibus sit cauendum. Datum etc.
msItem.ab: Verses on Evangelium: on the Church (Fata monent) etc.

head.title: De Tartaris e Jordano Minorita et aliis

msItem.incipit: De facto tartarorum uobis scribo
msItem.explicit: sarracenorum subuertuntur. Datum anno domini mo cco xxxo ixo
msItem.incipit: Humilis in Christo fidelibus uniuersis.. .frater Iordanus
msItem.explicit: sed in deo est uictoria
msItem.incipit: Dilecto ... principi barban'. H. dei gr. land'gie comes palatinus
msItem.explicit: non est audita a primo tempore christianitatis
msItem.incipit: Hos phalangus tartarorum orbis imperator
msItem.explicit: Datum in castris iuxta ingens flumen danubium
msItem.incipit: Honorius papa uolens scire terram sarracenorum
msItem.explicit: Isti rumores uenerunt parisius in crastino sancti petri

msItem.head: Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor, Epistolae

head.title: Frederici imperatoris epistolae duae ad Anglos contra papam

msItem.incipit: Fredericus dei gratia romanorum imperator
Et si cause uestre iusticiam
msItem.explicit: dilectio uestra credat. Datum taurini iio Aug. iii indictionis
msItem.incipit: Fredericus dei gratia etc. illos felices describat antiquitas
msItem.explicit: diligentiam adhibere

msItem.incipit: Conqueritur regnum anglorum ex eo quod dominus papa non est contentus
msItem.explicit: et penitus lacerantur
msItem.ab: This page is blank. An erasure and old pencil notes on f. 110v

head.title: Extracts from glosses on Old Testament
Visiones quaedam et narrationes de captivitatibus Israelis, et alia historica. -- Nullo ordine et imperfecta

msItem.ab: Notes apparently taken from a gloss or commentary on the books of Kings (Chron.?), Tobit, Judith, Esther, Daniel, Maccabees
msItem.incipit:
Ozia lepra percusso in fronte quia intrauit sancta sanctorum.
... Tempore mananeel (Menahem) uenit phul rex assyriorum cum exercitu
msItem.ab: (was deceived with brazen calves instead of golden ones)
Ends imperfectly (last page partly obliterated) on 2 Macc. I with the story of Nehemiah and the sacred fire

lg.l: Virgo parens vixit sexaginta tribus annis
Quatuor atque decem fuit in partu benedicta

msItem.incipit: Johannes Elham supprior huius ecclesiastica sacrosancte
